title: Deep Neural Networks with Symplectic Preservation Properties
abstract:
We propose a deep neural network architecture designed such that its output
forms an invertible symplectomorphism of the input. This design draws an
analogy to the real-valued non-volume-preserving (real NVP) method used in
normalizing flow techniques. Utilizing this neural network type allows for
learning tasks on unknown Hamiltonian systems without breaking the inherent
symplectic structure of the phase space.
